text: As the High Jarl, Geimdall is a loyal warmonger found always at King Ulfric's side - having joined him on countless raids and expeditions.
A top an elevated rise surrounded by stockades is the King's Hall, where Ulfric and his most loyal Jarls reside. It's a pinnacle of Bjornling strength.

Hornborg is a Norse Dwarf who runs an oddity shop in Skjold. Adventurers and Kings from all over travel to Skjold to barter with the stubborn dwarf, for among his trinkets are ancient artifacts of immense value.

Hafskael's Yard is a shipyard located at the base of Skjold's cliff. Here, the legendary shipbuilder Hafskael and his apprenctice Lars make longboats that would instill envy in the best sailors known to men.
Geimdall's Kingship joined the expedition led by High King Ulfric which led them to a deserted island inhabited by undead monks. Both warriors barely made it out with their lives intact.
Many of Bjornling warriors worship Odrall, who unlike in the lore of men, is known as a great wanderer and seafarer to the Norse.

Geimdall is argueably the strongest warrior among the Bjornling people, rivaled only by Oda Winterclaw and the High King himself. He has the loyalty of most Huscarl's, having led them in countless of raids.
Geimdall was not born a Norse noble, but has earned his title serving as a Huscarl. Skald's sing songs of the countless times he commanded the shield wall in battle.
As a Bjornling Jarl, Geimdall is a loyal warmonger found always at King Ulfric's side - having joined him on countless raids and expeditions.
Jarl Geimdall earned his title by leading the Huscarls of Oseberg when they followed King Ulfric on his quest to raid the Island of Lord Morr.
Geimdall's origins lay in Oseberg, the very stronghold Erik the Lost set out from on his expedition to Lustria. It is home to the finest warriors of the Bjornling tribe.
Geimdall is entrusted by the High King to lead the Bjornling Huscarl's in to battle, being the only one besides the High King having led the Bjornling tribe as a whole in to battle.
Passive Ability: "Oseberg's Champion" when on foot
Bound by honor and brotherhood, the Huscarls raise their shields as one, forming an unbreakable wall that turns aside the rain of arrows
A blade tempered by northern winds and salt, Havthrymr has cloven shields and skulls alike.
A vessel of legend, Drakkenguard was built from the ribs of a leviathan felled by Bjornling warriors and bound with iron said to be blessed by the gods. It does not sail—it hunts.

Geimdall, the pride of Oseberg, stands as its greatest champion, following in the footsteps of legends like Erik the Lost and Erik Losteriksson, his name destined to be carved into the sagas of the north.

A finely honed blade, its steel tempered by the cold northern winds and the salt of the sea. Havthrymr has split shields and skulls alike in countless battles, its edge never dulling, its name whispered in reverence by those who know the fury of the Bjornling Huscarls.

Carved from the horn of a sea-beast slain in ancient times, Bjornsmál is more than a war horn—it is the voice of the Bjornlings' fury. Its deep, mournful call rolls across the waves like a storm, stirring the blood of warriors and calling them to battle. To hear it is to know that war has come, and no man, beast, or god can silence its roar.
Carved from the horn of a slain sea-beast, Bjornsmál's deep call echoes like a storm, stirring Bjornling Huscarls to battle.
With bellowing shouts and violent gestures the natural leader of the Huscarls molds the shield wall into a impregnable bulwark of Northern might.
Can not engage in melee combat when actively commanding the shield wall
From raw meat to salted fish, the Bjornling are known to live the true carnivor way - taking all the graceful Gods offer their lands.
Melee defence: %+n for Shielded Marauder units
Unit experience gain: %+n% for Shielded Marauder units

No traitor has ever stepped aboard Geimdall's Kingship and lived to tell the tale—its hull carries the weight of Geimdall’s unwavering honor. Legends say that the ship itself remembers betrayal, the timbers creaking with whispers of broken vows. Those who break their oaths to the High Jarl find no refuge upon its deck, for the sea itself conspires against them—storms rise without warning, ropes snap like strangling hands, and the water drags them down, never to be seen again. Only those whose word is iron may sail beneath its banners, for treachery finds no quarter on the Oathbreaker’s Bane.
Missile resistance: %+n% for Norscan Longship units\\n\\n[[col:red]][[i]]Note: Requires the Norscan Longship mod to be activated.[[/i]][[/col]]

The men trained by the King's Huscarls raise their shields with choreographical precision.
Ability: "Geimdall's Shield Wall" for Shielded Marauder units
The war is endless. The cycle of charging, clashing, and bloody hand-to-hand fighting is without end. It will never stop.
The war is endless. The cycle of charging, clashing, and bloody hand-to-hand fighting is without end. It will never stop.
The war is endless. The cycle of charging, clashing, and bloody hand-to-hand fighting is without end. It will never stop.

Geimdall stands as the right hand of High King Ulfric Grondal, a warrior of peerless skill and unwavering loyalty. Raised in the storm-lashed holds of the Bjornlings, he fought his first battle before he could grow a beard, carving out his place among the huscarls with axe and shield. Over the years, his name became legend among his kin, not merely for his prowess in war, but for his wisdom in matters of blood and steel. To the Bjornling huscarls, the elite guard of their war-kings, Geimdall is more than a war leader—he is a spiritual guide, the one who reminds them of their sacred duty to fight, raid, and die with honor.His devotion to Ulfric is absolute, for he sees in the High King the will of the gods made manifest. He has led countless expeditions across the Sea of Claws, raiding the soft lands of the south and returning with treasures, thralls, and war-stories told over roaring fires. Yet, his ambitions do not end with mere plunder. Geimdall dreams of conquest, of carving out a Bjornling dominion beyond the waves. His gaze is fixed upon Bretonnia—a land of weak men hiding behind high walls and chivalric lies. He sees their knights not as noble warriors, but as prey waiting to be brought low. One day, he swears, the Bjornling banners will fly over their stone keeps, and the sagas will tell of how Geimdall led the north to claim its rightful place in the south.
